TopicTitle: Are there any 2 man, 1.25 meter capsules that look like stock?

Articles.Content: I've not been able to find any 1.25 meter capsules that have the same design of say, a Mk1-2 pod, or the Taurus HCV capsule. Any suggestions?
FASA maybe? http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/24867-0-90-FASA-Feb-20th-90-Release-v5-22 Not sure about the stock-alike look though.
Yeah that and K2 are the few I've found that even have 1.25m 2 man capsules, but both are Gemeni in looks.
Maybe Monkey Business http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/111669-0-90-Monkey-Business-Inc and
Tantares? http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/81537-0-90-Tantares-Stockalike-Soyuz-and-MIR-22-16-04-2015-Cygnus-Mk2-Release
Novapunch has a two man pod, not sure about stockalike though. http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/3870-0-90-NovaPunch-2-08-Dec-17th-0-90-Compatibility-Minor-Update

Novapunch has a two man pod, not sure about stockalike though. http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/3870-0-90-NovaPunch-2-08-Dec-17th-0-90-Compatibility-Minor-Update

Yeah it looks good, but again it's not 1.25m.

I wonder how tweaking some of these steeper sloped 2 man capsules would work though...

Edited April 22, 2015 by MarcAlain

How about a quick ghetto hack on a Mk1-2 pod ? The configuration file below, placed anywhere within the GameData subdirectory structure, uses the model for the stock 3-man Mk1-2 pod, resized to 1.25m and stretched a bit, configured for 2 kerbals with proportionally adjusted costs and capacities. The top will conveniently fit a junior docking port or Mk-16 parachute. 

PART
{

// --- general parameters ---
name = Mark1-3APod
module = Part
author = Roxette // C. Jenkins

// --- asset parameters ---

MODEL
{
model = Squad/Parts/Command/Mk1-2Pod/model
texture = mk 1-2 external shell Variant-Hatch , Squad/Parts/Command/Mk1-2Pod/
scale = 0.5, 1.1, 0.5
}

scale = 1
rescaleFactor = 1

// --- node definitions ---
// definition format is Position X, Position Y, Position Z, Up X, Up Y, Up Z
node_stack_bottom = 0.0, -0.48, 0.0, 0.0, 1.0, 0.0, 1
node_stack_top = 0.0, 1.3, 0.0, 0.0, 1.0, 0.0, 1

// --- editor parameters ---
TechRequired = specializedControl
entryCost = 6800
cost = 1800
category = Pods
subcategory = 0
title = Mk1-3A Command Pod
manufacturer = Kerlington Model Rockets and Paper Products Inc
description = This modern stretched cockpit is designed to be fully re-useable. Its semi-spacious cabin can hold a maximum of 2 crew.
// attachment rules: stack, srfAttach, allowStack, allowSrfAttach, allowCollision
attachRules = 1,0,1,1,0

// --- standard part parameters ---
mass = 2.1
dragModelType = default
maximum_drag = 0.20
minimum_drag = 0.15
angularDrag = 2
crashTolerance = 18
maxTemp = 3400

vesselType = Ship

// --- internal setup ---
CrewCapacity = 2

INTERNAL
{
  name = PodCockpit
}

MODULE
{
	name = ModuleCommand
	minimumCrew = 1
}

RESOURCE
{
	name = ElectricCharge
	amount = 100
	maxAmount = 100
}

MODULE
{
	name = ModuleReactionWheel

	PitchTorque = 7
	YawTorque = 7
	RollTorque = 7

	RESOURCE
	{
		name = ElectricCharge
		rate = 0.8
	}
}
MODULE
{
	name = ModuleScienceExperiment	

	experimentID = crewReport

	experimentActionName = Crew Report
	resetActionName = Discard Crew Report
	reviewActionName = Review Report

	useStaging = False	
	useActionGroups = True
	hideUIwhenUnavailable = True	
	rerunnable = True

	xmitDataScalar = 1.0
}
MODULE
{
	name = ModuleScienceContainer

	reviewActionName = Review Stored Data
	storeActionName = Store Experiments
	evaOnlyStorage = True
	storageRange = 2.0
}

RESOURCE
{
	name = MonoPropellant
	amount = 20
	maxAmount = 20
}

MODULE
{
      name = FlagDecal
      textureQuadName = flagTransform
}
}

How about a quick ghetto hack on a Mk1-2 pod ? The configuration file below, placed anywhere within the GameData subdirectory structure, uses the model for the stock 3-man Mk1-2 pod, resized to 1.25m and stretched a bit, configured for 2 kerbals with proportionally adjusted costs and capacities. The top will conveniently fit a junior docking port or Mk-16 parachute.

Looks great man! That's as good as I think I can find for now

What would I edit in the config to get the 2 man cfg file to work with the new heatshields? I feel like I adjusted the correct values, yet this happens:

http://i.imgur.com/Yb86ZmO.jpg
Just offset the heatshield to where you want it to be, heating affects should work as normal.
Right, but which value affects this? I've changed a few and it doesn't seem to change where the heatshield attaches vertically.

Right, but which value affects this? I've changed a few and it doesn't seem to change where the heatshield attaches vertically.

in the config it's the "node_stack_bottom" line. You will have to adjust the =.48 down (I would try something on the order of .65 first)

Right, I have tried that but I get a different problem. The heatshield doesn't want to attach :

http://i.imgur.com/TJ9LBym.jpg
There is orionkerbin's snack pack as well, but it's not been updated In a while.

There is orionkerbin's snack pack as well, but it's not been updated In a while.

You may have posted in the wrong thread

You may have posted in the wrong thread

Or, I posted here because.... This
Ah, that's not his snack pack

How about a quick ghetto hack on a Mk1-2 pod ? The configuration file below, placed anywhere within the GameData subdirectory structure, uses the model for the stock 3-man Mk1-2 pod, resized to 1.25m and stretched a bit, configured for 2 kerbals with proportionally adjusted costs and capacities. The top will conveniently fit a junior docking port or Mk-16 parachute. 

PART
{

// --- general parameters ---
name = Mark1-3APod
module = Part
author = Roxette // C. Jenkins

// --- asset parameters ---

MODEL
{
model = Squad/Parts/Command/Mk1-2Pod/model
texture = mk 1-2 external shell Variant-Hatch , Squad/Parts/Command/Mk1-2Pod/
scale = 0.5, 1.1, 0.5
}

scale = 1
rescaleFactor = 1

// --- node definitions ---
// definition format is Position X, Position Y, Position Z, Up X, Up Y, Up Z
node_stack_bottom = 0.0, -0.48, 0.0, 0.0, 1.0, 0.0, 1
node_stack_top = 0.0, 1.3, 0.0, 0.0, 1.0, 0.0, 1

// --- editor parameters ---
TechRequired = specializedControl
entryCost = 6800
cost = 1800
category = Pods
subcategory = 0
title = Mk1-3A Command Pod
manufacturer = Kerlington Model Rockets and Paper Products Inc
description = This modern stretched cockpit is designed to be fully re-useable. Its semi-spacious cabin can hold a maximum of 2 crew.
// attachment rules: stack, srfAttach, allowStack, allowSrfAttach, allowCollision
attachRules = 1,0,1,1,0

// --- standard part parameters ---
mass = 2.1
dragModelType = default
maximum_drag = 0.20
minimum_drag = 0.15
angularDrag = 2
crashTolerance = 18
maxTemp = 3400

vesselType = Ship

// --- internal setup ---
CrewCapacity = 2

INTERNAL
{
  name = PodCockpit
}

MODULE
{
    name = ModuleCommand
    minimumCrew = 1
}

RESOURCE
{
    name = ElectricCharge
    amount = 100
    maxAmount = 100
}

MODULE
{
    name = ModuleReactionWheel

    PitchTorque = 7
    YawTorque = 7
    RollTorque = 7

    RESOURCE
    {
        name = ElectricCharge
        rate = 0.8
    }
}
MODULE
{
    name = ModuleScienceExperiment    

    experimentID = crewReport

    experimentActionName = Crew Report
    resetActionName = Discard Crew Report
    reviewActionName = Review Report

    useStaging = False    
    useActionGroups = True
    hideUIwhenUnavailable = True    
    rerunnable = True

    xmitDataScalar = 1.0
}
MODULE
{
    name = ModuleScienceContainer

    reviewActionName = Review Stored Data
    storeActionName = Store Experiments
    evaOnlyStorage = True
    storageRange = 2.0
}

RESOURCE
{
    name = MonoPropellant
    amount = 20
    maxAmount = 20
}

MODULE
{
      name = FlagDecal
      textureQuadName = flagTransform
}
}

Interesting, I want to give this a go but I am unsure of how to do it, do I just copy the Mk1-2 Command Pod folder and replace the .cfg with this?

EDIT- Nevermind, though the same thing as mentioned several posts up happens to me when the heatshield won't attach correctly, the top node does not connect but the bottom does which is not good. Any adjustments I can make to the .cfg to make it work properly?

Edited April 29, 2015 by Jumpyyoza

Finally, a perfect 2 man 1.25m capsule complete with service module, engine, and parachute/docking module.

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/121062-1-0-2-Corvus-Size-1-two-seat-command-pod%28Version-1-0%29?p=1934863&posted=1#post1934863
